revised_title: Spectroscopic Observations of the Sun: Chromosphere and Prominences
tldr: The authors conducted spectroscopic observations of the sun, focusing on the chromosphere and prominences, between October 1872 and December 1873. They used a 6-inch refracting telescope and a spectroscope with a diffraction grating to study the sun's spectrum and the positions of prominences. The observations provided valuable data on the sun's structure and behavior, which could be used in conjunction with other researchers' work to better understand solar phenomena.
